disease: Merkel cell carcinoma of right upper limb, including shoulder

symptoms.name: Painless, firm, dome-shaped, red, and ulcerated lesion
symptoms.pattern: Localized to the right upper limb, including shoulder

physical_findings: 12 cm × 10 cm fungating soft tissue mass
No evidence of axillary or cervical lymphadenopathy
Firm, enlarged, elevated lymph node (in some cases)

lab_values.Histology: Ulcerated and invasive tumor involving the dermis; composed of sheets of monotonous atypical round cells with hyperchromatic nuclei; positive for chromogranin, CD56, and CK20; negative for S-100, TTF-1, LCA, and Melan-A

risk_factors: Central distribution of the tumor (head and neck)

imaging_findings.MRI: Superficial and subcutaneous mass without underlying muscle involvement

required: Histological examination showing sheets of monotonous atypical round cells with hyperchromatic nuclei
Immunohistochemical staining positive for chromogranin, CD56, and CK20; negative for S-100, TTF-1, LCA, and Melan-A
supportive: Clinical presentation of a painless, firm, dome-shaped, red, and ulcerated lesion
Imaging findings consistent with a highly vascularized mass
